item.title: FAQ
item.description: Question Index: Where can I find you across the web? Who are you? What languages do you know? What keyboard do you use? What languages do you use for Game Development? Why C? How did you learn to write code? What do you recommend to learn C? What do you think of Rust? Why are you building a game engine for your game?

item.title: Portfolio
item.description: Astera Astera is one of my primary projects currently. It’s a cross platform game library written in C99. The technologies it uses are: C, CMake, GLFW, OpenGL, OpenAL, nanovg, stb image & vorbis, and GLAD. Everything else in the project is self written! It currently builds and runs on Windows, Mac, and Linux with planned support for Web/HTML5! Dungeon Example This example runs most all of the different components in Astera to give a real world example of a game running with it.

item.title: Services
item.description: You can find my resume here! Hello! I’m Devon, I work primarily focusing on creating high quality & high performance software. Usually I work on (but am not limited to) the following kinds of projects: Games & Game Engines General & Enterprise Software Small-medium sized websites for small businesses & friends Here are some of the programming languages Iâ€™m most comfortable with: C/C++ Java C# / .NET HTML / CSS Python SQL (MSSQL & MySQL) BASH / Unix Shell As well as some libraries/technologies I can use:
